Fortunately, this is not the path that indicates the commission to whom we should thank for their effort in pointing out a different route.

At this point, in the need for the Union, in the need for shared efforts, I would like to express my gratitude to Mr. Barroso for, just yesterday, in Cádiz, making a forceful statement on the interpretation of the treaties regarding a secessionist scenario within the Union.

"I clearly and unequivocally state that, as per the treaties, if a part of a member state separates and becomes an independent state, it will be considered a third party, and therefore, will not be affected by any declarations or effects of the treaty."
I await, Mr. Vice President, in the absence of the President, that this doctrine, safe and constant, of the commission may remain alive to guarantee it for everyone.
